long_description.overview: An in-process transport adapter for rapid local development and tests. It simulates broker behavior without external infrastructure so handlers and outbox flows can be exercised fast.
long_description.why_it_exists: Developers need instant feedback loops without provisioning real brokers.
long_description.primary_audience: Service developers writing handlers and tests.
value_props: Deterministic, fast test runs for handlers
Parity with production envelopes without network costs
long_description.monetization_signal: Open source utility for dev/test only.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Fault injection toggles (delay, drop, duplicate) to harden handlers.
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements the Transport adapter slot; used by Testing harnesses.
long_description.demo_path: Publish an event in-memory and assert handler outcomes within a single process.

long_description.overview: Azure Storage Queues adapter for HoneyDrunk.Transport. A lightweight, cost-friendly broker for simple queue semantics and background processing.
long_description.why_it_exists: Some workloads need durable queues without the complexity of full-fledged brokers.
long_description.primary_audience: Teams deploying on Azure with simple FIFO/background jobs.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Batch receive and visibility timeout tuning templates.
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements the Transport adapter slot; emits telemetry into Pulse.
long_description.demo_path: Emit outbox events → observe dequeue/handle lifecycle via Pulse traces.

long_description.overview: Azure Service Bus adapter with topics/subscriptions support, sessions, and exactly-once-ish handling aligned to the Transport envelopes.
long_description.why_it_exists: Event-driven services on Azure need high-throughput pub/sub with robust delivery semantics.
long_description.primary_audience: Production services that require topics, sessions, and partitioning.
long_description.monetization_signal: Open core adapter; enterprise tuning guides later.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Advanced dead-letter strategies and per-subscription filters.
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements the Transport adapter slot; integrates with Vault for secrets and Pulse for telemetry.
long_description.demo_path: Publish to a topic, handle via subscription, trace causality across services.

long_description.overview: Common telemetry contracts and helpers shared by adapters and services: span/metric naming, correlation, and severity conventions.
long_description.why_it_exists: Without shared contracts, telemetry becomes noisy and incomparable.
long_description.primary_audience: Developers instrumenting services and building sinks.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Expand semantic conventions for background jobs and brokers.
long_description.grid_relationship: Backs all Pulse telemetry modules and service instrumentation.
long_description.demo_path: Wrap a handler with shared helpers and see consistent spans in Pulse.

long_description.overview: OpenTelemetry wiring for the HoneyDrunk stack. OTLP exporters, resource detection, and auto-instrumentation presets.
long_description.why_it_exists: Standards-based telemetry reduces lock-in and unlocks rich tooling.
long_description.primary_audience: Service owners who want end-to-end traces and metrics quickly.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Sampling strategies and baggage propagation guides.
long_description.grid_relationship: Feeds Pulse. Works alongside vendor sinks like Sentry/PostHog.
long_description.demo_path: Enable preset → see service map and latency histograms in minutes.

long_description.overview: Sentry sink for error events and enriched traces with release and environment tagging.
long_description.why_it_exists: Tight error feedback loops demand actionable, enriched events.
long_description.primary_audience: Teams who prefer Sentry for error tracking.
value_props: Release + env tags out of the box
long_description.roadmap_focus: Performance spans alignment and sampling controls.
long_description.grid_relationship: One of Pulse’s optional sinks; coexists with OTLP export.
long_description.demo_path: Throw an exception and inspect the correlated event in Sentry.

long_description.overview: PostHog sink for product analytics and event capture aligned to the shared telemetry schema.
long_description.why_it_exists: Creators need behavior analytics without distorting engineering telemetry.
long_description.primary_audience: Product-facing services and web apps.
value_props: Clean event mapping from shared contracts
long_description.grid_relationship: Optional Pulse sink for creator/product analytics.
long_description.demo_path: Emit a PageViewed event and analyze funnels in PostHog.

long_description.overview: File-based secret provider for local/dev scenarios. Reads secrets from encrypted files with audit-friendly structure.
long_description.why_it_exists: Local parity with production vaults prevents secret sprawl and ‘works on my machine’.
long_description.primary_audience: Developers and CI running in ephemeral environments.
value_props: Encrypted at rest with simple rotation
Consistent key shapes for easy swap to cloud providers
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements Vault’s provider slot; used by most services locally.
long_description.demo_path: Switch from File to AzureKeyVault without code changes.

long_description.overview: Azure Key Vault provider with MSI support, versioned secrets, and policy-based access for services on Azure.
long_description.why_it_exists: Production services require managed identities and audited retrieval at scale.
long_description.primary_audience: Ops and service owners running in Azure.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Bulk rotation helpers and secret scanning integration.
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements Vault’s provider slot; integrates with Pulse for secret errors.
long_description.demo_path: Migrate secrets from File provider to Key Vault in minutes.

long_description.overview: AWS Secrets Manager provider offering basic retrieval and caching aligned to Vault contracts.
long_description.why_it_exists: Cross-cloud teams need first-class AWS support without forking patterns.
long_description.primary_audience: Services deployed on AWS or hybrid footprints.
value_props: Aligned key shapes with other providers
long_description.roadmap_focus: Rotation hooks and IAM policy templates.
long_description.grid_relationship: Implements Vault’s provider slot; forwards failures to Pulse.
long_description.demo_path: Switch from AzureKeyVault to AWSSecretsManager via config only.

long_description.overview: Test harness library for spinning up deterministic environments, faking time/randomness, and wiring Transport/Vault locally.
long_description.why_it_exists: Flaky tests and slow setup kill momentum; batteries-included harnesses fix that.
long_description.primary_audience: Developers writing unit and integration tests.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Golden-path templates for common service types.
long_description.grid_relationship: Docks to Testing node; integrates with Pulse for trace snapshots.
long_description.demo_path: Run a sample test suite that emits stable traces across runs.

long_description.overview: Snapshotting utilities that record canonical traces for flows and compare them across runs to catch regressions.
long_description.why_it_exists: Behavior drift is hard to spot; trace diffs make it obvious.
long_description.primary_audience: Teams hardening critical event paths.
value_props: Golden trace fixtures stored alongside tests
Tight hooks into Transport and Pulse
long_description.roadmap_focus: Better diff visualizations and flaky-span detection.
long_description.grid_relationship: Docks to Testing; reads from Pulse for reference spans.
long_description.demo_path: Record a baseline trace, change code, and watch the diff highlight risky changes.
long_description.signal_quote: If it changed, you’ll see it.

long_description.overview: Region-scoped agent that procedurally authors Gigs using POI data, seasonal events, and house style guides.
long_description.why_it_exists: Bootstraps and refreshes local content without a centralized editorial team.
long_description.primary_audience: Market ops, city curators, and auto-maintained catalogs.
value_props: High coverage with low manual effort
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumes POI adapters; publishes to HiveGigs via Transport; secrets via Vault; telemetry to Meta.
long_description.demo_path: Seed a city → generate 20 Gigs → publish preview.

long_description.overview: Location verification with radius/shape geofences, dwell-time checks, and spoofing heuristics.
long_description.why_it_exists: Prevents fake completions and anchors IRL Gigs to real places.
long_description.primary_audience: All IRL Gig categories.
long_description.grid_relationship: Integrates with POI provider; emits verification events to HiveGigs API and HiveXP.
long_description.demo_path: Enter fence → satisfy dwell → emit verified completion.

long_description.overview: Photo/video evidence checker using object detection/OCR prompts tied to Gig templates.
long_description.why_it_exists: Adds visual proof for challenges that need more than a GPS ping.
long_description.primary_audience: Museums, landmarks, scavenger tasks.
long_description.monetization_signal: Quality gate for premium creator payouts.
long_description.grid_relationship: Stores artifacts in Vault-backed storage; emits pass/fail to HiveGigs and HiveXP.
long_description.demo_path: Upload artifact → detect target → verify.

long_description.overview: OpenStreetMap-backed POI adapter with filters for parks, museums, and cultural venues.
long_description.why_it_exists: Gives agents structured seeds for Gig generation.
long_description.primary_audience: Agent writers and curators.
long_description.grid_relationship: Feeds Agents.Writer; shares cache with Geo verifier.
long_description.demo_path: Query city → return POIs → generate candidate Gigs.

long_description.overview: Creator earnings and sponsor payments via Stripe Connect with split rules per Gig.
long_description.why_it_exists: Turns creation into income, safely and at scale.
long_description.primary_audience: Quest authors, partners, and Market ops.
long_description.grid_relationship: Uses Vault for secrets; emits financial events to Meta/MarketCore.
long_description.demo_path: Complete Gig → credit creator → payout batch.

long_description.overview: Real-time alerts for nearby Gigs, expiring missions, and creator earnings.
long_description.why_it_exists: Keeps engagement loops tight and timely.
long_description.primary_audience: Players and creators.
long_description.grid_relationship: Push via Transport; web/mobile via SignalR or FCM/APNs bridge.
long_description.demo_path: Enter zone → receive mission ping → accept.

long_description.overview: Standardized ingestion of XP events from Nodes via Transport envelopes.
long_description.why_it_exists: Prevents bespoke XP plumbing per product.
long_description.primary_audience: Any Node emitting XP (Gigs, HoneyHub, HoneyPlay).
long_description.monetization_signal: Internal backbone for all Market-facing XP loops.
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumes Transport; validates against Core schemas; forwards to Ledger.
long_description.demo_path: Emit event → validate → ledger write.

long_description.overview: Auditable XP transaction store with category partitions and rollups.
long_description.why_it_exists: Single source of truth for progression.
long_description.primary_audience: XP consumers and analytics.
long_description.grid_relationship: Writes to SQL via Core data conventions; emits change feed to Analytics.
long_description.demo_path: Insert XP → query level/rollup → verify audit.

long_description.overview: Exponential level curve with configurable base and scaling factors.
long_description.why_it_exists: Gives consistent difficulty ramp across products.
long_description.primary_audience: Designers setting progression pace.
long_description.grid_relationship: Plug-in to Engine; used by Leaderboards/Profiles.
long_description.demo_path: Set curve → simulate 1–50 → export thresholds.

long_description.overview: Default XP categories (Creation, Discovery, Social, Learning) with weights and display strings.
long_description.why_it_exists: Shared language of effort across Nodes.
long_description.primary_audience: All XP emitters/consumers.
long_description.monetization_signal: N/A; improves UX consistency for Market products.
long_description.grid_relationship: Served by API; cached by clients; logged in Ledger.
long_description.demo_path: Fetch pack → emit events by category → show profile rollups.

long_description.overview: Sorted-set leaderboards by category, region, and time window.
long_description.why_it_exists: Fast public rankings without hitting the ledger hot path.
long_description.primary_audience: Public apps and Market surfaces.
long_description.monetization_signal: Premium board filters and seasonal events.
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumes events from Ledger; exposes cached reads to apps.
long_description.demo_path: Emit XP → board update → query top N.

long_description.overview: Rule-based achievements over XP events and category milestones.
long_description.why_it_exists: Adds durable goals beyond raw levels.
long_description.primary_audience: All consumer apps.
long_description.grid_relationship: Reads Ledger; writes badge events; surfaces to Leaderboards/Profiles.
long_description.demo_path: Define rule → ingest events → award badge.

long_description.overview: Batch and streaming exports of XP events and rollups to the analytics warehouse.
long_description.why_it_exists: Lets Meta/Market surfaces run deep analysis without hammering OLTP.
long_description.primary_audience: Ops, analytics, and growth.
long_description.monetization_signal: Enables premium analytics for Market products.
long_description.grid_relationship: Reads from Ledger; writes to warehouse; cataloged in Meta.
long_description.demo_path: Replay last 24h → build dashboard.
